item.title: No Street nameplate with house numbers, 24th January
item.description:
At the top of the Ridge Grove the road branches left to houses 3, 4, 5 and 6 and right to houses 7, 8, and 9, but there is no road sign to indicate which house numbers are in which direction. This means that people looking for houses 3 to 9 have no idea which way to turn, resulting in cars turning around on the driveways of the houses at the end of the road when they've turned the wrong way. Many other estates have road signs that indicate which house numbers are in which direction: I would like to see one at the top of Ridge Grove. It has been like this since the estate was completed by Bellway. I did raise the issue with Bellway when they first put the Street Nameplates in but they informed me that they had no complusion to add more they had been required to do by the Planning Regulations. It is a constant source of inconvenice for everyone, both residents and visitors, and could easily be resolved with one sign at the top of Ridge Grove. Note that although it is clear in the photo I've just taken, cars do park right across the top of the road so any sign would need to mounted above the height of a parked car.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bluebell Crescent, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double yellow lines barely visible, 24th January
item.description:

item.title: Deep, unavoidable, dangerous pot holes, 24th January
item.description:
Pot holes open up here every few months as fixing it with paper mache doesn't seem to hold up. The current ones are particularly deep and dangerous. I buckled my wheel on Thursday. 2nd time in 3 years I've done that there. At night, due to cresting the hill, you don't see them until too late, and they get worse every day so it's hard to avoid.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
